Package javelin.model.unit.abilities.spell.conjuration

Class Summon

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.controller.upgrade.Upgrade
      • javelin.model.unit.abilities.spell.Spell
        • javelin.model.unit.abilities.spell.conjuration.Summon
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, Cloneable
    public class Summon
extends Spell
    Brings an ally to fight with your team. Upper Krust's method is not followed here since it makes no sense for a Gelugon (CR21) that could summon another Gelugon to be CR21.4. The next attempt has been to have Spell CR equal Summoned CR/5 - the rationale being that a summoned ally would only participate in one fight out of 5 moderate encounters before resting. This has also proved naive. The current method averages the result of the previous one with that of the spell being cast on round 1 by an enemy (who will always have the spell available, unlike a party member). Instead of applying full CR, uses 50% of it instead - first because a monster summoning a copy of itself doesn't double its CR; second because it's not a guarantee that the monster will be able to cast it before being engaged, killed, etc. TODO This should not be a Spell. See cast(Combatant, Combatant, boolean, BattleState, ChanceNode) Since we can't possibly add all Summon spell to the proper Conjurer Kit, other locations are avialable for different Monster.MonsterType summon spells, such as the SummoningCircle and the Henge.
    See Also:
    Conjurer#SUMMONS, Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • monstername

        public java.lang.String monstername

      • SUMMONS

        public static final java.util.List<Summon> SUMMONS
        Every summoning Spell, for each Monster available. Since we don't want these to completely overwhelm the kit, only one per Spell.casterlevel is registered with the kit iself. More can be accessed through SummoningCircles.

      • cast

        public java.lang.String cast​(Combatant caster,
                             Combatant target,
                             boolean saved,
                             BattleState s,
                             ChanceNode cn)
        Description copied from class: Spell
        Once the spell hits, apply effect.
        Overrides:
        cast in class Spell
        saved - true in case the target's saving throw was successful.
        s - Should modify this directly (no internal cloning).
        cn - Can be used to set ChanceNode.overlay. Might be null, for example, if this spell is being triggered by an Attack effect.
        Returns:
        Description of outcome (do not assign to ChanceNode.action directly).

        Returns:
        The location the monster was summone at.

      • select

        public static java.util.List<Summon> select​(java.util.List<Summon> pool,
                                            int perlevel,
                                            int casterlevel)
        Since there's one Summon per Monster in the game, this method helps summoning kits to offer a sensible amount of spell choices.
        Parameters:
        pool - What pool of Summons to choose from - usually Summon#ALLSUMMONS or a filtered version of it.
        perlevel - How many spell instances to return, for each level. Note that this is the maximum limit, as it may not find enough (or any) spells to fulfill this target.
        casterlevel - Only gather summons of this given Spell.casterlevel.
        See Also:
        Stream.filter(java.util.function.Predicate)

      • select

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Summon> select​(java.util.List<Summon> pool,
                                                 int perlevel)
        Returns:
        The result of calling select(List, int, int) with Spell.casterlevel 1 through 9.

      • setupsummons

        public static void setupsummons()
        Unlike most Upgrades, Summon Spells need to be created after all Monsters are loaded.
        See Also:
        MonsterReader
